courseInfo.title: วิยุตคณิต
courseInfo.semester: ภาคปลาย ปีการศึกษา 2568
courseInfo.period: 1 พฤศจิกายน 2568 – 1 มีนาคม 2569

description: หลักการและแนวคิดพื้นฐานของคณิตศาสตร์ไม่ต่อเนื่อง ทฤษฎีเซต ตรรกศาสตร์ และการพิสูจน์ ฟังก์ชันและความสัมพันธ์ การนับและความน่าจะเป็น กราฟและต้นไม้ พีชคณิตบูลีน

schedule.topic: Mathematical Language & Sets; Set Identities; Recursive Definitions
schedule.notes: Proof overview; direct proof and counterexample; prove basic set identities from definitions.

schedule.topic: Propositional Logic: Connectives, Equivalences, CNF/DNF (semantic), Inference Rules
schedule.notes: Method of Proof I: direct, contrapositive, contradiction; use logical equivalences as proof steps.

schedule.topic: Predicate Logic: Quantifiers, Scope, Nested Quantifiers, Translation
schedule.notes: Method of Proof II: quantified statements; build countermodels; rigor with domains and bound/free variables.

schedule.topic: Induction I (weak): sums/products, inequalities, divisibility; recursion correctness on ℕ
schedule.notes: Induction template (base, step, measure); choosing the inductive parameter; prove termination for simple recursion.

schedule.topic: Induction II: strong induction; well-ordering; structural induction (strings/trees)
schedule.notes: Structural induction on recursively defined sets; minimal counterexample idea and when to use it.

schedule.topic: Functions & Relations: injective/surjective/bijective, composition, inverse; relation properties
schedule.notes: Prove injective/surjective from definitions; construct counterexamples for relation properties (reflexive/symmetric/transitive).

schedule.topic: Equivalence Relations & Partitions; Partial Orders & Hasse Diagrams; Review
schedule.notes: Prove equivalence/poset properties; diagram literacy; targeted midterm review problems.

schedule.topic: สอบกลางภาค
schedule.notes: Midterm covers Weeks 1–7: logic, proof methods (direct/contra/contradiction), induction (weak/strong/structural), functions & relations.

schedule.topic: Counting I: Sum/Product Rules; Permutations & Combinations; Binomial Theorem; Bijective Proofs
schedule.notes: Model-before-count; two-way counting; build bijections to justify identities.

schedule.topic: Counting II: Multisets; Stars & Bars; Inclusion–Exclusion; Generalized Pigeonhole
schedule.notes: Set up cases cleanly; compare bijective vs inductive proofs of identities; sharpen bounds.

schedule.topic: Recursive Problem Solving; Recursion and Induction (integration workshop)
schedule.notes: From recursive specs to recurrences; prove correctness with induction; small code-adjacent proof exercises.

schedule.topic: Recurrences I: linear homogeneous (constant coefficients); combinatorial interpretations (Fibonacci, tilings)
schedule.notes: Solve via characteristic equations; verify closed forms by induction; sanity checks against counting stories.

schedule.topic: Recurrences II: non-homogeneous; simple divide-and-conquer; intro to ordinary generating functions (OGFs)
schedule.notes: Derive recurrences from specs; sketch OGF derivations; confirm results with induction where feasible.

schedule.topic: Graphs I: definitions, degree sequence, handshaking lemma, isomorphism basics, connectivity, bipartite graphs
schedule.notes: Parity/invariant arguments; minimal-counterexample basics; prove classic degree and connectivity facts.

schedule.topic: Trees: properties (n−1 edges, unique paths), traversals; spanning trees; MST ideas (Kruskal/Prim concepts)
schedule.notes: Induction on |V| or |E|; leaf-peeling arguments; cut/cycle properties as proof sketches.

schedule.topic: สอบปลายภาค
schedule.notes: Final covers Weeks 9–15: counting, recursive problem solving, recurrences/OGFs, graphs and trees; short structured proof tasks.
